[File: config/src/config/state_sync_config.rs] [Test: test_optimize_bootstrapping_mode_devnet_vfn] [Incomplete Test] Does this test verify that devnet VFNs don't change bootstrapping mode, but miss testing whether they SHOULD change for safety? (Low)

[File: config/src/config/state_sync_config.rs] [Test: test_optimize_bootstrapping_mode_no_override] [Override Safety] Does allowing local config override of bootstrapping mode on testnet create security risks from misconfigured nodes? (Medium)

[File: config/src/config/state_sync_config.rs] [Test: test_optimize_prefetcher_mainnet_validator] [Resource Impact] Does the test verify that doubled prefetching (12 concurrent requests) doesn't exceed validator resource limits? (Low)

[File: config/src/config/state_sync_config.rs] [Test: test_optimize_prefetcher_vfn_no_override] [Partial Override] Does allowing partial override (state requests but not transaction requests) create inconsistent prefetching behavior? (Low)

[File: config/src/config/state_sync_config.rs] [Test: test_sanitize_auto_bootstrapping_fast_sync] [Edge Cases] Does the test cover all bootstrapping modes or only DownloadLatestStates for the auto-bootstrap check? (Medium)

[File: config/src/config/state_sync_config.rs] [Field: max_concurrent_requests * 2] [Multiplication Overflow] Can the optimization that doubles max_concurrent_requests for validators cause integer overflow if the default is near u64::MAX/2? (Low)

[File: config/src/config/state_sync_config.rs] [Field: num_versions_to_skip_snapshot_sync] [Version Number Overflow] Can setting num_versions_to_skip_snapshot_sync to 400M cause overflow when added to current blockchain version? (Medium)

[File: config/src/config/state_sync_config.rs] [Calculation: 5k TPS * 24 hours] [Comment Accuracy] Does the comment claiming 400M versions = 24 hours at 5k TPS match the actual calculation, or could miscalculation lead to incorrect snapshot thresholds? (Low)

[File: config/src/config/state_sync_config.rs] [Calculation: ~3 blocks/sec * 15 seconds] [Subscription Math] Does max_num_consecutive_subscriptions (45) actually provide 15 seconds at 3 blocks/sec, or can faster block rates exhaust subscriptions prematurely? (Medium)

[File: config/src/config/state_sync_config.rs] [Calculation: ~3 blocks/sec * 3 seconds] [Inflight Math] Does max_in_flight_subscription_requests (9) provide adequate buffering at 3 blocks/sec, or can burst production cause subscription failures? (Medium)

[File: config/src/config/state_sync_config.rs] [Struct: StateSyncConfig] [Component Mismatch] Can mismatched chunk sizes between data_streaming_service and storage_service cause data truncation or protocol failures? (High)

[File: config/src/config/state_sync_config.rs] [Struct: StateSyncConfig] [Timeout Hierarchy] Are timeout values properly ordered (client < server, initial < max), or can misconfiguration cause deadlocks? (Medium)

[File: config/src/config/state_sync_config.rs] [Struct: StateSyncConfig] [Concurrent Request Limits] Can the interaction between max_concurrent_requests (6), max_concurrent_state_requests (6), and max_pending_requests (50) create resource bottlenecks? (Medium)

[File: config/src/config/state_sync_config.rs] [Multiple Fields] [V2 Protocol Migration] Can nodes with enable_transaction_data_v2 in some components but not others create protocol incompatibilities? (High)

[File: config/src/config/state_sync_config.rs] [Default: enable_auto_bootstrapping = false] [Production Safety] Is disabling auto-bootstrapping by default safe, or can it cause new nodes in small networks to never sync? (Medium)

[File: config/src/config/state_sync_config.rs] [Default: enable_subscription_streaming = false] [Performance Impact] Does disabling subscription streaming by default force inefficient polling, degrading sync performance? (Low)

[File: config/src/config/state_sync_config.rs] [Default: enable_dynamic_prefetching = true] [Stability Risk] Is enabling dynamic prefetching by default safe for all network conditions, or can it cause instability? (Low)

[File: config/src/config/state_sync_config.rs] [Default: enable_multi_fetch = true] [Bandwidth Impact] Does enabling multi-fetch by default increase bandwidth consumption beyond what nodes can handle? (Low)

[File: config/src/config/state_sync_config.rs] [Default: ignore_low_score_peers = true] [Peer Selection] Can ignoring low-score peers by default create network partition risks if scoring is manipulated? (Medium)

[File: config/src/config/state_sync_config.rs] [Default: use_compression = true] [Compression Risks] Does enabling compression by default expose all nodes to compression bomb attacks without rate limiting? (Medium)
